page.title: 04S/COMMON SHOOTING FERRETING
page.content: In Somerford Common and surrounding area Shooting is rented from the Forestry Commission. There is a syndicate of nine guns and a full time Gamekeeper patrols the Common almost daily. There are 370 acres and a lot of work has been done in the 1980's to clear paths through the woodland and keep them clear. In 1985 200 pheasants were reared and put down in the Common. During the seasons approximately 100 pheasants are shot. The Gamekeeper also arranges ferreting and clay pigeon shooting. Farmers also raise their own pheasants and enjoy the sport of shooting. The local community do not ming these activities.
